OOC: That's what I was trying to tell you. It was made for children because=
 children were their audience...

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: E=
mprzAnastazia@... 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Saturday, Janu=
ary 04, 2003 9:11 PM
  Subject: Re: assorted thoughts


  In a message date=
d 1/4/03 3:42:26 AM Central Standard Time, hollywood.narrator@... w=
rites:



    OOC: Adults of the time? Transformers came out in 1984, and t=
he movie came out I believe in 1986, so you have to expect it to be a "kid'=
s movie." However, the original theatrical presentation of the movie featur=
ed the words "damn" and "shit," and thus would qualify it as having adult l=
anguage, yes?...


  Just because of the words, which they were taken out t=
o my knowledge & later readded.... by film critics, it's a children's movie=
. Go to your local Video rental store & search for it under any other title=
, but I guarnatee you will only find it under Childrens. It's primary forcu=
s was upon the Gen X/kids of that time. Few adults liked it as much as the =
kids, unlike now, where Gen 1 is huge because it was what we grew up upon. =

  Yes, it was released in '86, 2 years after Transformers arrived in the U=
S. But no one grows up that quickly. I was 8 in '84 & 10 in '86. 

  stac 
=

              ADVERTISEMENT
             
  =

f Service.
